translations.text: All that is in the heavens and all that is in the earth extols Allah's glory.<sup foot_note="182100">1</sup> His is the sovereignty<sup foot_note="182101">2</sup> and to Him is all praise due;<sup foot_note="182102">3</sup> He has power over everything.<sup foot_note="182103">4</sup>

He it is Who has created you: and among you are those that deny the Truth<sup foot_note="182104">1</sup> and among you are those that believe in it.<sup foot_note="182105">2</sup> Allah observes all that you do.
He created the heavens and the earth with Truth and shaped you, giving you excellent shapes. And to Him is your ultimate return.<sup foot_note="182106">1</sup>

He knows what is in the heavens and the earth, and knows what you conceal and what you disclose.<sup foot_note="182107">1</sup> Allah even knows what lies hidden in the breasts of people.<sup foot_note="182108">2</sup>
Has the news of the unbelievers of the past not reached you? (They disbelieved) and then tasted its evil consequence. A grievous chastisement awaits them.<sup foot_note="182109">1</sup>

This was because their Messengers would come to them with Clear Signs,<sup foot_note="182110">1</sup> but they would say: “Shall mortals (like ourselves) guide us to the Right Way?”<sup foot_note="182111">2</sup> They rejected the Truth and turned away. Thereupon Allah became unconcerned with them, for Allah is Self-Sufficient, Innately Praiseworthy.<sup foot_note="182112">3</sup>

The unbelievers have vehemently contended that they shall not be raised to life.<sup foot_note="182113">1</sup> Say to them: “Yes, by my Lord, you shall surely be raised to life,<sup foot_note="182114">2</sup> and you shall certainly be fully informed of all that you did. <sup foot_note="182115">3</sup> That is easy enough for Allah.”<sup foot_note="182116">4</sup>
So believe in Allah and in His Messenger and in the Light that We have sent down.<sup foot_note="182117">1</sup> Allah is fully aware of what you do.

(You shall come to know that) when He will assemble you on the Day of Gathering.<sup foot_note="182118">1</sup> That shall be the Day (to determine) mutual gains and losses.<sup foot_note="182119">2</sup> Whoever believes in Allah and acts righteously,<sup foot_note="182120">3</sup> Allah will have his evil deeds expunged and will admit him to Gardens beneath which rivers flow. Therein they shall abide forever. That is the supreme triumph.
As for those who disbelieved and gave the lie to Our Signs:<sup foot_note="182121">1</sup> they shall be the inmates of the Fire, and will abide in it. That is a woeful resort!

No misfortune<sup foot_note="182122">1</sup> ever befalls unless it be by Allah's leave.<sup foot_note="182123">2</sup> And whosoever has faith in Allah, Allah directs his heart along the Right Path.<sup foot_note="182124">3</sup> Allah has knowledge of everything.<sup foot_note="182125">4</sup>
Obey Allah and obey the Messenger. But if you turn away from obedience, (then know that) Our Messenger has no other duty than to clearly convey the Truth.<sup foot_note="182126">1</sup>
Allah there is no god but He; in Allah should the believers put all their trust.<sup foot_note="182127">1</sup>

Believers, there are enemies to you from among your spouses and your off-spring, so beware of them. But if you forgive and overlook their offences and pardon them, then surely Allah is Most Forgiving, Most Compassionate.<sup foot_note="182128">1</sup>
Your possessions and your offspring are nothing but a trial for you. And there awaits a great reward<sup foot_note="182129">1</sup> for you with Allah.

So hold Allah in awe as much as you can,<sup foot_note="182130">1</sup> and listen and obey, and be charitable. This is for your own good. And whoever remains safe from his own greediness, it is such that will prosper.<sup foot_note="182131">2</sup>

If you give Allah a goodly loan, He will increase it for you several fold<sup foot_note="182132">1</sup> and will forgive you. Allah is Most Appreciative, Most Forbearing.<sup foot_note="182133">2</sup>
He knows that which is beyond the ken of perception as well as that which can be perceived. He is the Most Mighty, the Most Wise.
